com.inqwell.any

Class LocateNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.inqwell.any.AbstractFunc
      • com.inqwell.any.LocateNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Any, Func, Locate, NamedFunc, Serializable, Cloneable

    public class LocateNode
extends AbstractFunc
implements Locate, Cloneable
    Given an Any structure and a node specification, locate the node in the structure described by the specification.

    Location may be either strict or lazy. If strict then the exact structure described by the specification must be found when locating the node. A lazy location allows for a path component to be absent at the current node, when a breadth first iteration is performed in an attempt to find it.

    A locate path is of the form w.x*y.z where * and . are delimiter characters separating the various path elements. As the path is consumed the most recent separator controls the strictness of the next element: "*" means lazy while "." means strict. Strictness can only be controlled in this way and in initially set to lazy. Hence to enforce a strict location at the outset a path like .x.y.z can be used.

    The exec(Any) method will apply the location from the given node unless there is a preferredRoot, in which case that is used as the location root instead.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.7 $
    Author:
    $Author: sanderst $
    See Also:

        Specified by:

        public void reset()
        Reset this instance for re-use. Discards any nodes and parents remembered from the last execution. Should be called if this instance would not normally be garbage collected, so as to avoid dangling references to nodes which should be collected themselves.
